Welcome to rex’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class rex.Experiment(xlfile='', sheet='', text='', prompt=None, delim='t', txt_col=6, autoload=False, debug=0)¶

This class represents the default experimental data super class that all individual classes call to

Variables that can be called to Experiment: xlfile = path to excel file sheet = name of experimental sheet prompt = experimental number (starts with 0) delim = either or , txt_col = column in row that contains ascii data filename debug = whether we should print out variables (0-10, 0 equals NO)

class rex.Curve(data_array, columns={})¶

This class represents an object storing curves as numpy arrays and plotting methods to allow quick visualization

the curve dictionary has two entires per key.
index 0 is a numpy array containing our data index 1 is a str with the axes information used when plotting

self._labels are common legend labels used when plotting. These are defined in the individual type files as a dictionary

add(name, list, axes='')¶

add a curve to the listing

compose(name, curves, stages, axes)¶
map provided lists to each stage

a curves and stages are lists

del_curve(key)¶

delete a curve from the listing

ex_label(label, argl)¶

return a string of all comments to be appended to the legend

ex_subplot(X, Y, vert=True, ttls='', argls='', **kwargs)¶

Y is a list of curve names, vert = vertical subplots if True
